Confronting poverty has to be great challenge of the next few years. Poverty destroys lives. It is insidious to society- Adults forced to skip meals so their children can eat enough to be full: kids without access to a warm coat, or two pairs of shoes.
https://t.co/ekPLAQcmYv

Hey folks,
On June 28th, I’m hosting a public meeting concerning the future of the former Magdalene Laundry site on Seán McDermott St.
We’re going to have some discussion, music, and stories.
Come along. It’s at 7:00pm in the Belvedere Youth Club.
https://t.co/n8w4ExlZnc
@matthewathome Absolutely Matthew!
@CllrDuncanSmith My heart is broken in town with it- I have strongly come to believe that we need stronger Garda involvement in it.

At this mornings Joint Policing Meeting, I’ve just asked the Gardai to take a larger role in confronting those who engage in illegal dumping. We need to start prosecuting those who engage in this deplorable form of anti-social behaviour. #DublinCentral

@LiamD_23 @GraceCuddihy @SocDems Hey guys! You’re right- we do need a strong, progressive migration policy. I believe that @ChineseforumIE from our @SocDemsDBN branch was working on it.
@MuireannMontyQ Yeah- they’re my favourite window into that part of our history. I used to love reading them in college but only recently went back to them.

t’s a fascinating read. Sir Eithne as she became, was hugely powerful and it was said that Irish politicians would come visit her, either at her command, or just to chat with her about Collins right up until the 1970’s when she died.

This is very interesting
It’s the Bureau of Military history Witness Statement of Ms. Evelyn Lawless. She was the personal secretary 2 Michael Collins until 1920 when she became a nun in the Gloucester Laundry- (The Magdalene Laundry on Seán McDermott)
https://t.co/8zqFBf331g

I met ‘Jenny’ late last year. Her story left me cold for weeks- she’s not that much older than myself, and escaped from the Magdalene Laundry in 1993.
Thanks to @DeirdreFalveyIT for capturing her heartbreaking story so well.

@TomClonan @eibhear The next election has to be fought on social justice/ poverty. 790,000 people living in poverty, and Fine Gael looking to extend Confidence & Supply because they believe they’re doing such a good job.. They must be confronted on this.

Leo Varadkar’s undoubted brilliance is unseen by those who are unfit for their positions, clearly incompetent, or plain stupid.
And did you see those new socks? The best of all the socks in the land. https://t.co/xLTe6LCKc2

@garrettmullan It’s an important position- the last three Presidents we’ve had have made huge contributions to who we are as a society. I’ll likely be voting Michael D, but I would like to hear a renewal of his vision for the next 7 years, & also create space for competent others to share ters.

@garrettmullan There should be one. SF have every right to place a candidate forward- If they feel they’ve an appropriate candidate, It’s hardly flag waving to contest an election. A 17 year old in 2011 would be 34 by the time they get to vote for a president if there’s no election.
@angiebeeb 😂🙏

@dlooney Splitter!! ☺️
14 years is too long a duration in office without electoral mandate.
But yes, I wouldn’t be facilitating the nomination of any of the candidates to so far express an interest.
But that’s not to say stronger candidates won’t emerge once it’s a contest.
Sterling & Lingard look up for this! #ENGCOL

This is the correct decision. Democracy requires participation & contest. It would take a lot for me not to vote Michael D- but I hope some more stronger candidates emerge in the coming weeks also. https://t.co/Ob61nE3kIa
